page.title: 01FELTHAM
page.content: Feltham is situated on the western outskirts of London. It lies between the M3 and M4 motorways and is built on the gently rolling land of the London Basin.Its importance throughout the ages has been dependant upon communications; primarily with the 'Coaching Roads'and then with the Flying Air Ships (Hanworth Air Park); a large Railway Terminal (once one of if not the largest in Europe) and more recently its trade and industry is very closely linked with Heathrow Airport. The area surrounding Feltham has had other facets of economic and Historical importance such as numerous sand and gravel pits which are now reservoirs and Tudor Court which dates back to Henry viii.
